file_content.text: [It appears Valon has not activated the thermal bore device. It should be safe to remove it.]
Soldier said Valon could not fall. But again you triumph, Herald. One blessed by Scorekeeper cannot fail.
If Valon hadn't forced my hand, we could have taken him prisoner.
I'd have preferred him alive.
Losing all points is worse than death. You acted rightly.
I wonder why Valon gave the coalition soldiers so much trouble.
So he can die after all.
Frozen planet blunted their edge, maybe.
You're right.
Should hurry, Herald. Device must be returned, and cold makes hunter's blood run slow.
Ugh. Glad I don't have a sense of smell. That Valon looks like he needed a bath.
Um, is it me, or was that brigand rather less immortal than expected?
He has certainly become one with the Force.
It appears so.
A powerful opponent, but hardly an unstoppable one. Curious.
This does seem strange.
Just needed a Jedi's touch.
Hmph. Perhaps that oafish lieutenant has told his men too many ghost stories.
No matter. We'd better take that device back, and get out of this intolerable cold.
That coalition soldier said Valon couldn't die. Looks dead to me.
Valon was a worthy opponent. He deserves a little respect.
Don't be callous.
Why? He can't hear us.
The conditions here, seeing friends die... no wonder the coalition began to think Valon was invulnerable.
The soldiers likely lost hope.
I imagine you have a lot of experience determining that, Zenith.
Well, you'd know.
Yes, I do.
Too chilly to stand around. We should get the device back to Lieutenant Iresso.
